meanings.definition: A group of people working together, especially in a band or gang.
meanings.sent1: The crue gathered to plan their next performance.
meanings.sent2: The music crue practiced together every day.
meanings.sent3: The crue's teamwork made their show a success.
meanings.sent4: The crue was a tightly knit family on and off stage.
meanings.sent5: The image of the crue working in harmony stayed with the audience.

meanings.definition: To be cruel or unkind to someone.
meanings.sent1: She didn't want to crue anyone's feelings, so she spoke gently.
meanings.sent2: He would never crue an animal; he loved them all.
meanings.sent3: The siblings would crue each other playfully, but always with love.
meanings.sent4: The harsh words seemed to crue her heart like ice.
meanings.sent5: The memory of his unkindness continued to crue her thoughts.
